text: Sir Thomas Gresham (c. 1519 â€“ 21 November 1579) was an English merchant who worked for King Edward VI of England and for Edward's half-sister Queen Elizabeth I of England. He was born in London in an old Norfolk family, he was the son of Sir Richard Gresham and had one brother and two sisters. Gresham's law was named after him in 1858. Category:1510s births Category:1579 deaths Category:People from London
title: Thomas Gresham
